keyword: how many calories in fried eggs
title: How Many Calories Are in Fried Eggs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in fried eggs (for 2 large), including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Fried Eggs?
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), fried in minimal oil (1 tsp total for 2 eggs), sunny-side up, no added salt or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, oil amount, cooking method, and added ingredients. Check labels or use a tracker for precision.

quick_answer.text: Two large fried eggs provide about 184 kcal and 13 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in butter (1 tsp total extra)

faqs.q: How many calories in one fried egg?
faqs.a: About 92 kcal for one large fried egg with minimal oil.

faqs.q: Are fried eggs higher in calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added oil or butter; fried adds ~14 kcal per egg vs. boiled.

faqs.q: How much protein in two fried eggs?

faqs.a: Very lowâ€”about 0.8 g carbs for two eggs, mostly from the yolk.

faqs.q: What affects calories in fried eggs?
faqs.a: Oil or butter amount, egg size, and cooking time; more fat increases calories.
